meanings.definition: Encouraging or stirring up violent or unlawful behavior.
meanings.sent1: The inciting words of the angry man led to a fight breaking out.
meanings.sent2: The inciting behavior of the troublemaker caused chaos in the school.
meanings.sent3: The inciting graffiti on the wall made everyone laugh at its boldness.
meanings.sent4: Her inciting gestures were like sparks igniting a fire of rebellion.
meanings.sent5: The inciting music at the protest rally fueled the crowd's anger.

meanings.definition: Provoking or urging someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The inciting message in the letter pushed him to take action.
meanings.sent2: Her inciting look dared him to join in the adventure.
meanings.sent3: The inciting challenge from his friend made him smile and accept.
meanings.sent4: His inciting tone in the speech inspired the audience to stand up for change.
meanings.sent5: The inciting aroma of freshly baked cookies tempted everyone to indulge.
